data.question: What is the critical temperature (Tc) of [FeCp*]2@[TCNE]?
What material was reported to have a Tc exceeding room temperature?
How is the a-polymorph of manganese phthalocyanine tetracyanoethenide obtained?
data.answer: By grinding MnPc and TCNE followed by dissolution of the soluble product into MeCN.

data.question: What is the Tc of [MnTPP]2@[TCNE]?
What is the average effective moment peff for the a-phase of [MnPc]2@[TCNE]?
What is the average theta (θ) value for the a-phase of [MnPc]2@[TCNE]?
What is the goal of studying molecule-based magnets with enhanced Tcs and θs?
data.answer: To elucidate the importance of 1D interactions with respect to 3D interactions, establish the structure-function relationship for this new class of materials, and characterize new molecule-based magnets.

data.question: Why is the effective moment peff value for the a-phase lower compared to [MnTPP][TCNE] . 2PhMe?
data.answer: Because the average effective moment peff for the a-phase is 4.95 pB, which is lower than the 5.12 pB reported for [MnTPP][TCNE] . 2PhMe.

data.question: Is the magnetic susceptibility x of [MnTPP]2@[TCNE] fit to the Curie-Weiss expression between 115 and 250 K?
Is the a-polymorph of manganese phthalocyanine tetracyanoethenide obtained by direct reaction of MnPc and TCNE in refluxing MeCN?
Does the P-phase of manganese phthalocyanine tetracyanoethenide consist of parallel, albeit interleaving, 1D chains?
Is the magnetic behavior of a-[MnPc]2@[TCNE] characterized as ferrimagnetic?
Does the P-phase of [MnPc]2@[TCNE] exhibit stronger magnetic coupling than the a-phase?
Is the susceptibility of P-[MnPc]2@[TCNE] fit by the Curie-Weiss expression above ca. 130 K?
Are the intrachain [MnPc]2@[TCNE] planes essentially parallel to each other?
Is the effective magnetic-ordering temperature of a-[MnPc]2@[TCNE] estimated to be 40 K?
What is the role of TCNE in the synthesis of manganese phthalocyanine tetracyanoethenide?
data.answer: TCNE acts as a reactant in the synthesis process, forming a complex with manganese phthalocyanine.

data.question: What is the significance of the θ value in the study of molecule-based magnets?
data.answer: The θ value indicates the strength of magnetic coupling, with larger values suggesting stronger magnetic interactions.

data.question: How does the structure of the P-phase of manganese phthalocyanine tetracyanoethenide differ from the a-phase?
data.answer: The P-phase consists of parallel, albeit interleaving, 1D chains, while the a-phase is obtained through a different preparative route and has distinct magnetic properties.

data.question: What is the effect of the direct reaction of MnPc and TCNE in refluxing MeCN?
data.answer: It leads to the formation of the P-polymorph of manganese phthalocyanine tetracyanoethenide.
